page.title: 14BERWICK CHURCH, NR ALFRISTON
page.content: The present church of St. Michael and All Angels was built about the middle of the 12th Century on an existing barrow. The Saxon font belonged to the 'Conquest Church' and on the wall nearby are marks where bowmen sharpened arrows on Sundays before practising archery. Bombs dropped in the 1939-45 war destroyed the church windows and Bishop Bell decided this catastrophe presented an opportunity for using artists' work on walls instead of windows. This resulted in decoration of the interior by Clive and Vanessa Bell, their son Quentin and daughter Angelica and Duncan Grant. Local people were used as models in religious and Sussex scenes and the murals were dedicated in October 1943.
